result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah Hayat Jicha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: 22CF108 and 22CF634

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

No Contact with AT&T. No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
Comply with any Mental Health/Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. 
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Cash bail applied to Restitution for AT&T. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:35 p.m.
Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court for Leah Hayat Jicha. 
Defendant Leah Hayat Jicha in court, in custody.  
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 3 YEARS
Initial Confinement:  1 YEAR
Extended Supervision: 2 YEARS
Sentence is to run Consecutive to 22CF108 and 22CF634.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  3 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No contact with: AT&T
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

RESTITUTION:  $1,000.00 to AT&T (to be paid from the Cash Bail in case 22CF108);
COSTS:  $268.00 
DR GOD SURCHARGE:  $10.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To Be Paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.

records.addlTxt:
Hearing on April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.

09:31 AM Defendant Leah Hayat Jicha in court, in custody, with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for review hearing in 22CF108 and 22CF308.
Atty Mcmahon was only recently appointed. 
Report found Defendant to be competent.
State is in agreement with the findings.
Attorney Mcmahon is not challenging the doctors report.  Defendant does not wish to challenge the report.
Court finds the Defendant to be competent and cases may proceed.
State has complied with victim's rights.
Defense has filed a motion to modify bail in 22CF545.
Defense makes argument for reducing bail on the record.
State objects to any modification of bail for reasons as stated on the record.
Defense requests that all cases be placed on the calendar for preliminary hearing as soon as possible. 
Defendant's father makes statement to the court.
The Court will not take any action on bail at this time.
Court will set a bail/bond hearing in front of Judge Melvin to allow defense to secure a place for the Defendant to stay for treatment and potentially someone who could co-sign a signature bond.
All cases to be set for Preliminary Hearing.
Defense tolls time limits for preliminary hearing.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
